comment._content: This is a wonderful shot. What a great idea, hunting on a railway jigger!

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content:
Cool, huh? I'm pretty sure it's one of Williams' staged photos, I hate to think of the havoc that could result from taking potshots from a moving jigger!

Courtney

comment._content: It's so nice to see a Central Otago image here.

comment.author: 25306332@N05
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Vintage Hunting & Fishing , and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 41065234@N07
comment._content: The information with this says "This photo was taken some time in 1900 in Cromwell, Otago." However, the 20km line through the Cromwell (Dunstan) Gorge wasn't started until 1914 and was finished in 1921. The original information with this photo says "Otago Central Railway" and another jigger rabbit shooting photo by Williams apparently taken at the same time, seems to have been taken in the Taieri Gorge, so this is probably the Taieri Gorge. The vegetation cover and the photographer's age (he's the man in the photo with the rifle), also seems to support this.

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content:
Finncraft - thanks for the extra information.  I will pass it on to our curators.

-Chelsea
